跳.definition: to jump; to hop; to skip over; to bounce; to palpitate

跳井.definition: to jump into a well (to drown oneself, esp. of ladies in fiction)

跳傘.definition: to parachute; to bail out; parachute jumping

跳出.definition: to jump out; fig. to appear suddenly

跳出火坑.definition: lit. to jump out of a fire pit (idiom); to escape from a living hell; to free oneself from a life of torture

跳出釜底進火坑.pinyin: tiao4 chu1 fu3 di3 jin4 huo3 keng1
跳出釜底進火坑.definition: out of the frying pan into the fire (idiom)

跳動.definition: to throb; to pulse; to bounce; to jiggle; to jump about

跳擋.definition: (of a car) to slip out of gear; to pop out of gear

跳梁.definition: to jump up and down; to run rampant

跳槽.definition: to leave one's job to take up a position elsewhere

跳樓.definition: to jump from a building (to kill oneself); fig. to sell at a large discount (in advertising)

跳樓機.definition: drop tower; free fall tower (amusement ride)

跳水.definition: to dive (into water); (sports) diving; to commit suicide by jumping into water; (fig.) (of stock prices etc) to fall dramatically

跳河.definition: to drown oneself by jumping into the river

跳皮筋.definition: to play rubber band jump rope

跳票.definition: (finance) (of a check) to bounce; (fig.) (of a product etc) to fail to be released on schedule

跳繩.definition: to jump rope; to skip; a skipping rope; a jump rope

跳脫.definition: (Tw) to break free of (outmoded ways of thinking etc); to move beyond; to transcend

跳腳.definition: to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc); to dance on one's feet; hopping mad (anxious, etc)

跳臺.definition: diving platform; diving tower; landing platform

跳躍.definition: to jump; to leap; to bound; to skip

跳車.definition: to jump from a car (or train etc)

跳軌.definition: to jump onto the tracks in a suicide attempt

跳轉.definition: (computing) to jump to (a new location in a hypertext document)

跳進.definition: to plunge into; to jump into

跳進黃河洗不清.pinyin: tiao4 jin4 Huang2 He2 xi3 bu4 qing1
跳進黃河洗不清.definition: lit. even jumping into the Yellow River can't get you clean; fig. to become inexorably mixed up; mired in controversy; in deep trouble

跳過.definition: to jump over; to skip (a step, chapter etc)

跳閘.definition: (of a circuit breaker or switch) to trip; to jump a turnstile

跳集體舞.definition: to do ensemble dancing; to dance in a group

跳電.definition: (of a circuit breaker or switch) to trip
